title: The Will to Perceive vs. the Reality of Power: Why Do Humans Act? Exploring Apex Existentially.
description:
Paul's life story:  Living Outside the Frame https://youtu.be/xmWOvxO44HE
Iain McGilchrist video I quoted:  https://youtu.be/M-SgOwc6Pe4
Bruchko by Bruce Olson - book mentioned by Karen

Paul Gordon Collier talks to Karen about his exploration of an idea he calls Apex Existentiality. In this conversation, we sought a shared framework of understanding, but for a big idea like this, more than one conversation will be necessary. 

The three planes of existentially:  Ideational, Genetic, Physiological
The will to perceive is at war with the reality of power.

Ideational is the will to have your ideas lived out in others consensually (voluntarily) rather than coercively or cooperatively.

Apex existentially corresponds to Ecclesiastes 3:11 "He has placed eternity in your hearts."

The heart of flesh v. the heart of stone (which represents certainty, absoluteness, a desire to rule the world)

God is the source of value and not value itself.

Ideas are not as important as the vehicles through which they're expressed.
The authority which possesses the factitious (the high quality material means of communicating) can convince anyone of anything.

Humiliation, humility, is the path to making space for Jesus to live in you so that His life in your life makes you more of who you are meant to be as a vital member of the body, the whole yet part of the whole, unity in diversity.

Next time, we will view a graph Paul has created to explain his idea and we will also explore his definitions of meaning, freedom and value.
